intro: Dyschoriste repens, commonly known as creeping dyschoriste, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its slender, trailing stems form dense mats, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. The leaves are usually opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface.
